description: Beautiful. The integration is really well done.
one star less due to electron
it works well enough. i just dont understand why it keeps asking me to log back in. it gets really annoying

can hear a difference, it's just me. nice attempt to close the gap with adrenaline, but it's just not that last few percent that does make a big difference. especially in front of the computer. not so much in the gym or running. but sitting down, in front of the pc, need the lossless. otherwise, really beautiful interface, super appreciate the work. just with apple would bring lossless to linux. :(
The fact that it shows both podcasts and music in the same application is a big deal for me. Nice and performant, no real issues to complain of!

Amazing application. I have been looking for a better applicaiton to use for apple music on windows but found this on steam deck. Can't wait to add it to my main desktop as well. The GUI is pretty great and similar to apple music on Mac OS. Plus, with the Cider Adrenaline Processor I can't tell the difference between it and lossless audio.

This is the best apple music client I have come across, this is even better than the garbage apple music website , which apple dared call an decent web app. This has all the features I need and more, the only thing I would like the devs to maybe try is integration with the gnome desktop, the look is fine but a native app would look so much better.
summary: Apple should buy this and make this an official app

description: Works amazing in desktop mode - unfortunately it just crashes in gaming mode, can't find a fix anywhere.
The UI is great and it overall works perfectly.
The flatpak version is working fine on fedora 36.
Been waiting for a fully featured Apple Music client for a long time. Simple to use and includes all the features I expect. Well done!
The experience is much better than the web player and Cider is miles ahead of even the original iTunes app. Good job!

Please take my money, this is the best thing ever, even Apple couldn't take the time to develop this and you took the time to. I love you thank you. Its even faster than Apple's web version. Outstanding.

A fully-featured Apple Music player, with all the options you want and more I didn't even know I wanted until using this app. Runs flawlessly on Fedora 35 (flathub source). Discord integration also works perfectly, it shows playing a game called "Cider" or "Apple Music" (you can pick how it is displayed), with the track you are listening to, along with album art, how much time is left on the track and links to listen on Cider or View on Apple Music (unsure if these work). 
Finally I don't need to have a perpetually running Firefox tab for my music. Thank you.

It's great app with a simular design to that of Apple Music but all the controls and menus are actually in places that expect them to be in. What to add a song to your library? Right click and add. Done. No searching for little hidden menu buttons.

Works very well.
summary: Great App. Better then Apple Music on MacOS

description:
There have been a few released updates that the application doesn't work at all (processes launch, but no GUI) and requires going back to a previous commit 60b00c75bb661ceea9d32c349d249ec6c26a9f4f588fafcb0e1c2cad6312b075 is a current example and the second time that this has happened.

The 'love' a track interface is wonky and sometimes requires a few clicks to make sure that you have properly loved a track
summary: It's better than the web app, when it launches

description:
Finally a well-integrated open-source Apple Music client! The design is perfect for me, the performance could be a bit better - but it exceeded my expectations, and by a lot. Also, huge plus is the attention to detail (native window decoration option, MPRIS integration, etc).

It's not perfect, nor complete, but leaves most of the official solutions far behind (and not just talking about Apple Music here).

Thank you for your work!
summary: A surprise to be sure but a welcome one

description: Very well done, by far the best option for Apple Music users on Linux.

This is the most insane thing I've seen on Linux. A complete and masterful recreation of Apple Music with autoplaying lyric support, themes that match the artwork, and just a rock solid stable performance. It's also constantly updated which is so nice to see. 

Even on my Mac, I'm never going back to the Apple music app/itunes. It's Cider from here on out.
10/10. Perfection.
If Gapple Mooshic doesnt want to give us a client then someone will make a better client from scratch. Cider is one of em. Better than the stock music app on macos and iTunes on windows.
summary: Better than iTunes and Music on MacOS

description: Works well and a lot faster than the Apple Music Web App.
summary: A lot better than the Web Version

description: Way better than using the Apple Music web app. Cider has a clean interface, easy to use, and good audio quality. Almost looks like a native Apple application!
Excellent! Would recommend
Looks and feels even better than any original client!

I love that it's on flathub. It works perfecly. Even the discord integration works without any probleems on Fedora LInux. I am just amazed with this app. Please consider trying it out. (The remote app feature works as well)
Better user experience than iTunes, on par with the official Apple Music client.
Cider is perfect, thanks!
Sounds amazing, far better than web player, clean interface, just plain amazing.
Great attention to detail. I love this app.

Not only does it look great it runs great too. As someone else said it is way WAY better than the web client apple offers. I was a little bit disappointed in the lack of the app's ability to follow my breeze theming and button placement, as it is an electron app. But thanks to the healthy amount of customization I found in this app's settings, right down to theming support, that was easily taken care of for the most part.
Much better than music.apple.com. Apple shall fire all their Music web frontend enginners.
summary: Great app for Linux Apple Music users

description: Will be using this until need not to, would be nice for a Proper Gnome interface; but this app does look very nice!

Absolutely the best option if you want to listen to Apple Music on Linux whatsoever.
The app looks clean, is structured very well and connects flawlessly to your Apple ID.
Для тех у кого есть подписка на apple music, есть iphone, но нет macbook. Работает намного лучше чем web версия.
У меня ~2000 треков в коллекции. При нажатии на кнопку "Песни" приложение начинает очень сильно лагать и не отвечать на нажатия мыши.
